resource_dependency.customerDataSchema: Database table 'customers' with fields: id (UUID), name (string), email (string), phone (string), address (text), date_of_birth (date), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp)

function: Fetch and display customer information from the backend API.
static_description: A grid-based layout showing customer cards or a table listing customers with columns for name, email, phone, and registration date. Each row includes action buttons (Edit, Delete) styled with dark cyan icons on a whitesmoke background.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the Edit button opens a modal form pre-filled with customer data for editing.
Clicking the Delete button triggers a confirmation dialog before removing the customer record via DELETE /api/customers/{id}.

resource_dependency.postgresSchemaDefinition: CREATE TABLE customers (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255), email VARCHAR(255), phone VARCHAR(20), address TEXT, date_of_birth DATE, created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP, updated_at TIMESTAMP);

function: Establish connection to PostgreSQL database and define schema for storing customer data.
static_description: Backend service initializes connection to PostgreSQL using provided environment variables and creates the 'customers' table if it does not exist upon startup.

resource_dependency.policyDataSchema: Database table 'policies' with fields: id (UUID), customer_id (foreign key to customers.id), policy_type (string), start_date (date), end_date (date), premium_amount (decimal), status (enum: active/inactive/expired), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp)

function: Enable viewing and managing insurance policies associated with customers.
static_description: A tabbed interface showing a list of policies in a sortable table with columns: Policy Number, Customer Name, Type, Start Date, End Date, Premium Amount, Status. Action buttons for Edit/Delete are styled with dark cyan.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the Edit button opens a modal form populated with policy details for modification.
Clicking the Delete button prompts a confirmation dialog prior to deletion via DELETE /api/policies/{id}.

resource_dependency.postgresSchemaDefinition: CREATE TABLE policies (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, customer_id UUID REFERENCES customers(id), policy_type VARCHAR(100), start_date DATE, end_date DATE, premium_amount DECIMAL(10,2), status VARCHAR(20), created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP, updated_at TIMESTAMP);

function: Define and create database schema for storing policy-related data linked to customers.
static_description: The backend ensures the 'policies' table is created during initialization, enforcing referential integrity with the 'customers' table.

resource_dependency.claimDataSchema: Database table 'claims' with fields: id (UUID), policy_id (foreign key to policies.id), claim_date (date), description (text), amount_claimed (decimal), status (enum: pending/approved/rejected), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp)

function: Allow users to view and manage insurance claims related to policies.
static_description: A claims dashboard displaying a filterable table with columns: Claim ID, Policy Number, Claim Date, Description, Amount Claimed, Status. Buttons for viewing/editing/deleting claims use dark cyan styling.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking View/Edit opens a detailed claim form modal for reviewing or updating claim information.
Clicking Delete initiates a confirmation prompt followed by removal through DELETE /api/claims/{id}.

resource_dependency.postgresSchemaDefinition: CREATE TABLE claims (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, policy_id UUID REFERENCES policies(id), claim_date DATE, description TEXT, amount_claimed DECIMAL(10,2), status VARCHAR(20), created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP, updated_at TIMESTAMP);

function: Define and create database schema for claims linked to policies.
static_description: Ensures creation of the 'claims' table with proper foreign key relationships to the 'policies' table at application startup.

function: Generate various analytical reports based on collected business data.
static_description: Reports section featuring a dropdown menu to select report type, date range picker, and a Generate button. Output area displays generated reports either as downloadable PDFs or embedded documents within a whitesmoke-themed container.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting a report type and clicking Generate sends parameters to /api/reports endpoint which returns formatted report content.

function: Visualize key metrics and trends using interactive charts.
static_description: Dashboard panel containing multiple chart widgets (bar, line, pie) rendered using Chart.js library. Charts show data such as monthly policy sales, claim distributions, and customer acquisition rates against a whitesmoke background.

interaction_and_states.description: Hovering over chart segments reveals tooltips with precise numerical values and labels.
Clicking chart legends toggles visibility of corresponding datasets.

function: Apply consistent color theme throughout the application UI.
static_description: All page backgrounds set to whitesmoke (#F5F5F5). Primary interactive elements like buttons, links, and highlights styled with dark cyan (#008B8B). Consistent typography and spacing maintained across views.

function: Configure package.json script to install dependencies for both frontend and backend projects.
static_description: The root package.json contains an 'install:all' script that executes concurrent installations for frontend and backend node_modules using concurrently CLI tool.

resource_dependency.devScriptCommand: concurrently "npm run dev" "cd backend && npm run dev"

function: Set up development mode execution for full-stack local testing.
static_description: Root package.json defines a 'dev' script launching both frontend (Vite/Vue/etc.) and backend (Node.js/Express) servers simultaneously using concurrently.

function: Secure access to system resources through user authentication and role-based authorization.
static_description: Login screen with username/password fields and Submit button. Upon successful login, JWT token stored securely; subsequent requests include Authorization header. Unauthorized routes redirect to login page.

interaction_and_states.description: Submitting credentials calls POST /api/auth/login. Valid credentials return JWT used for future authenticated API requests.
Logout clears session/token and redirects to login page.

function: Enable searching and filtering across customer, policy, and claims datasets.
static_description: Search bar positioned atop main content areas with dropdown filters beside it. Filters allow narrowing results by entity attributes. Results update dynamically without page reload.

interaction_and_states.description: Typing into search bar debounces input and queries /api/search?q={term}&filters={} to retrieve filtered dataset.
Changing filter criteria updates query string sent to backend, refreshing displayed records accordingly.

function: Display summarized KPIs and operational insights on a centralized dashboard.
static_description: Admin dashboard presents metric cards showing total customers, active policies, open claims, etc., arranged in a responsive grid layout. Cards feature dark cyan borders/icons over whitesmoke background.

interaction_and_states.description: Dashboard fetches latest metrics from /api/dashboard/metrics and renders numeric values inside visually distinct cards.

function: Ensure usability and visual consistency across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.
static_description: UI components utilize flexbox/grid layouts adjusting to viewport size changes. Navigation menus collapse into hamburger menus on small screens. Tables become scrollable horizontally when needed.

interaction_and_states.description: Component dimensions adapt fluidly according to CSS media queries ensuring readability and accessibility regardless of device orientation or screen resolution.
